comments:
Since upgrading to OS X 10.4.4, I've been getting this error occasionally while launching a debugging session:

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.sun.jdi.VirtualMachineManager.createVirtualMachine(Lcom/sun/jdi/connect/spi/Connection;)Lcom/sun/jdi/VirtualMachine;
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.ConnectorImpl.establishedConnection(ConnectorImpl.java:98)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketListeningConnectorImpl.accept(SocketListeningConnectorImpl.java:129)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger$ConnectRunnable.run(StandardVMDebugger.java:78)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:552)

Eclipse is pretty much hanged until I kill the launched vm process from the Terminal.  The odd thing is this doesn't happen every time - occasionally I'm successful in launching and debugging my app.

java -version:
java version "1.5.0_05"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_05-72)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_05-44, mixed mode, sharing)
This is with 3.2M4 by the way.

Looks like bug 118517, but I haven't seen it in on M4. Could you attach the command line that launched the process next time you see it? You can copy and paste it from the properties of the Process in the DebugView.

Command line:

 /System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Versions/1.5.0/Home/bin/java -Xbootclasspath/p:/Users/jeff/Desktop/Development/eclipse-3.2m4/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.debug_3.2.0.v20051214c/jdi.jar -classpath /Users/jeff/Desktop/Development/eclipse-3.2m4/eclipse/startup.jar -Xdebug -Xnoagent -Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,suspend=y,address=localhost:49420 org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -launcher /Users/jeff/Desktop/Development/eclipse-3.2m4/eclipse/eclipse -name Eclipse -showsplash 600 -product org.eclipse.sdk.ide -data /Users/jeff/runtime-ve -configuration "file:/Users/jeff/Documents/workspaces/ve-dev/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/Run VE/" -dev "file:/Users/jeff/Documents/workspaces/ve-dev/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/Run VE/dev.properties" -pdelaunch -debug "/Users/jeff/Documents/workspaces/ve-dev/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/Run VE/.options" -os macosx -ws carbon -arch ppc
Jeff are you running both your host and target on Apple's 1.5 VM?
Looks like my host Eclipse was running with 1.4.2, and my target with 1.5.0.  Switching my host to 1.5 fixes this problem.  However shouldn't the host and target vms be allowed to mismatch?

Yes they should, but I do it all the time and haven't seen this problem yet. 

I suspect that sometimes apple's jdi implementation is getting found before ours, but your -Xbootclasspath/p:... parameter looks good so I'm not sure how that would happen, nor why it wouldn't happen consistently.
Marking as works for me. Please re-open if this continues to be a problem.
